intro: Palicourea lasiorrhachis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed palicourea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, and it produces small, globose fruits. Palicourea lasiorrhachis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets.
